pullrequest.title: add ros package joint_commands_gui from Maurice Fallon

content.raw:
Thanks John,
I'd suggest pairing it with this tutorial - as it overlaps quite a bit:
http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.0/Atlas_control_over_ROS_topics_with_python
It seems that Steven Peters is maintaining that one.
content.html: Thanks John, I'd suggest pairing it with this tutorial - as it overlaps quite a bit: http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.0/Atlas_control_over_ROS_topics_with_python It seems that Steven Peters is maintaining that one.

pullrequest.title: add ros package joint_commands_gui from Maurice Fallon

content.raw: As @scpeters , @hsu , and I discussed this morning, it would be better to put this package in a new top-level directory, called `examples` or `tutorials`.  That way we get the code out to people but don't make promises about supporting it.  That directory could come to contain code from our existing tutorials, too, which would be useful.
content.html: As @scpeters , @hsu , and I discussed this morning, it would be better to put this package in a new top-level directory, called examples or tutorials. That way we get the code out to people but don't make promises about supporting it. That directory could come to contain code from our existing tutorials, too, which would be useful.

pullrequest.title: add ros package joint_commands_gui from Maurice Fallon

content.raw:
On further investigation, I'm OK with leaving this package where it is, both in the source tree and the install tree.

It would be cleaner to separate it, but given that we don't support running ROS nodes from the source tree, to be useful, this package has to end up installed somewhere in `ROS_PACKAGE_PATH`, and so to keep it separate we'd need to create another installed directory to contain certain packages (e.g., `share/drcsim-x.y/ros_tutorials`) and add it to the path.  That doesn't seem worth it.

In addition, we currently have our not-so-pretty usage of `ExternalProject_Add()` confined to `ros/CMakeLists.txt`, and keeping that in one location is a good idea.    Presumably moving to catkin (issue #143) will simplify things.
content.html:
On further investigation, I'm OK with leaving this package where it is, both in the source tree and the install tree.

It would be cleaner to separate it, but given that we don't support running ROS nodes from the source tree, to be useful, this package has to end up installed somewhere in ROS_PACKAGE_PATH, and so to keep it separate we'd need to create another installed directory to contain certain packages (e.g., share/drcsim-x.y/ros_tutorials) and add it to the path. That doesn't seem worth it.

In addition, we currently have our not-so-pretty usage of ExternalProject_Add() confined to ros/CMakeLists.txt, and keeping that in one location is a good idea. Presumably moving to catkin (issue #143) will simplify things.
